channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
Once a long time ago I went to Microsoft with a plan to bring podcasting to all their users. What came from that meeting was typical corporate CYA, had nothing to do with the idea, which would have empowered users, but instead made them consumers of sanitized programming.
Nothing came of it of course, except now 18 years later Spotify et al are doing the same bullshit and calling it podcasting. Ultimately it may make some money for them, but it won’t further the cause. Pointless.
We need to create systems of governance that really empower the people, not try to con them into a safe sanitized feeling of power. As a child of the 60s I still have the dream, but I don’t think many of my generation remember.
Nothing short of total freedom to create for the people is enough or will work.

You can tell from his face that the war is killing him. I wonder how many people watching this on tv are aware that what’s happening to Ukraine is Trump’s vision of America. And if the Jan 6 attack on the Capitol had been SLIGHTLY more successful would be our reality today. https://t.co/yOJOR2vdij
Volodymyr Zelensky survives three assassination attempts in days. https://t.co/jIXtLY1YlZ
Here’s the message that wins the midterms for Democrats, if they’re not afraid. https://t.co/OJGjMETPZZ
It’s time for Putin to do the honorable thing and kill himself.

Shepard Smith on CNBC has the best coverage of the nuclear power plant that’s burning in Ukraine,
This is as crazy as Dr Strangelove.
Too bad they shut down Shepard Smith for the night. They should give him the 9pm slot on MSNBC
Seb Gorka is one of the extras on Fox News. https://t.co/nzhSYxtYrJ
Europe's largest nuclear power plant on fire after Russian attack, says local mayor. https://t.co/jn1DGKiz6C
Understanding the criminal allegations the Jan. 6 committee is constructing against Trump. https://t.co/KJhAt5ggHr
Russian military surrounds Europe’s largest nuclear power plant as Ukrainians block access roads. https://t.co/vLf6rmG3tD

I’m watching Fox again. Same level of superficial as CNN. Most of the ads are about pain and sleep. https://t.co/X2rpbZcJGh
OK they said something stupid about Biden so I switched back to CNN.
The big question is at what level should the US, NATO or individual countries take part in the war over Ukraine.
Is America to Blame for Russia’s War in Ukraine? https://t.co/HV9cTTGH27
Dems push DOJ to look at Trump after Jan. 6 panel's blockbuster. https://t.co/dK3LxB0wiV
@wmf @biannagolodryga a silver lining
@gwthompson i didn't get one.
Ukraine takes the resistance to cyberspace, assembling an ‘IT army’ to hack sites from Russia and its allies, calls on tech leaders to get involved. https://t.co/bU5bK8mQ5p
@RyanJones That sounds more likely, but you can own crypto without an account.

@RyanJones That sounds more likely. And btw -- that isn't the only way to own crypto, you can do it without an account. But her cynicism was the thing that got me. I tend to think of her as a victim, and that's

Journalism is presenting a very simple but untrue story about Russia and NATO and the US. What got me looking into this was the last episode of the Radio Open Source podcast. Highly recommended. https://t.co/nzQ1NJhWad
@RyanJones I don't see how you could know that, she certainly didn't say so.
I spent too much time studying maps as a kid. :-) #Worldle #41 1/6 (100%) 🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩🎉 https://t.co/bnHTZz2fpg

1/3 Hillary Clinton was interviewed on Maddow the other night. She said the crypto companies weren't cooperating in freezing accounts of Russians. She said it was some form of libertarian idealism, don't remember her exact words, but I do remember the tone -- sneering.
2/3 I think she got it wrong though, the accounts are anonymous, so they can't block Russians because they have no way of knowing who is Russian.
3/3 Then I heard a report on NPR just now, where they used the same terminology, without the sneering. So I wonder who got the wrong idea from whom?
And btw, it was HRC's naivete about tech that lost her the 2016 election, and led to the chaos of Trump as president. I tend to blame the journalists for being too stupid about tech to understand the supposed crime, but they didn't defend themselves either.
@jeffjarvis It’s remarkable that so far all the commenters think it’s true but none of them provide a source.
Why the World Must Resist Calls to Undermine the Internet. https://t.co/JJMcXCMw0o
